senses.de: A quick look at something or someone
senses.ex: I caught a glimpse of her as she rounded the corner.

Tips.title: Fleeting Sight
Tips.description: Used when something is seen for a very short time and not fully visible.
Tips.example: As the car sped by, I just got a glimpse of the driver.

Tips.title: Partial View
Tips.description: Glimpse suggests seeing only a part of the whole or seeing incompletely.
Tips.example: Through the crowd, I caught a glimpse of the celebrity's hat.

Tips.title: Unexpected Sight
Tips.description: Often refers to seeing something surprising or not planned.
Tips.example: We were walking when we got a glimpse of a shooting star.

senses.de: To look at something quickly or briefly
senses.ex: He glimpsed a figure dash past the window.

Tips.title: Quick Glance
Tips.description: To glimpse means to take a swift look, not examining something closely.
Tips.example: He glimpsed at his watch during the meeting.

Tips.title: Subtle Acknowledgement
Tips.description: May express a discreet or secretive acknowledgement of someone's presence.
Tips.example: She glimpsed toward her friend without alerting others.

Tips.title: In Passing
Tips.description: Implies looking at something while moving, without stopping to focus.
Tips.example: I glimpsed the new sculpture while jogging in the park.

senses.de: A brief experience or understanding of something
senses.ex: The book gives us a glimpse into life in 19th century Paris.

Tips.title: Brief Insight
Tips.description: A glimpse can give you a surface level understanding or feeling.
Tips.example: His smile gave me a glimpse of his true feelings.

Tips.title: Hint at More
Tips.description: Indicates there is more to be explored or discovered beyond the glimpse.
Tips.example: The documentary offers a glimpse into the complex issue.

Tips.title: Initial Encounter
Tips.description: Refers to an introductory view of something before fuller experience.
Tips.example: My trip to Japan provided a glimpse of its rich culture.

Glance.wordDefinition:
A glance is a quick look in a particular direction, while a glimpse is a brief, fleeting view or a small peek.

If you quickly look at something or someone and then turn away, you have taken a glance. This is useful when you want to quickly assess your surroundings or check if a friend is nearby.

For example, you might glance at the clock to see how much time you have left to complete a task.

Overall, both words are used to describe quick, brief looks, but a glance is a more intentional look in a particular direction, while a glimpse is a more accidental or fleeting view.

Look.wordDefinition:
Look refers to a deliberate act of directing your eyes towards something or someone, usually for a longer period of time.

For example, you would look at a picture in a museum to examine it closely, while you would glimpse a celebrity at an airport as they walk by quickly.

Essentially, look is used when you want to see something clearly and intentionally, whereas glimpse is used when you see something quickly and often accidentally.

Observation.wordDefinition:
Observation is a more deliberate and systematic act of watching or studying something carefully and thoroughly. It involves paying attention to details and recording data, and can be done with the intention of gaining knowledge, analyzing behavior or making a discovery.

"The scientist made observations of the bird's nesting habits for several weeks."

A glimpse is a casual or fleeting encounter or look, while observation is a focused and intentional act of examining and analyzing.

Peek.wordDefinition:
Both glimpse and peek refer to a quick and brief look at something, but there is a slight difference in their meaning and usage.

Peek means intentionally looking at something or someone quickly and secretly. It suggests that you're trying to sneak a look or see something without being noticed.

For example, if you look through a keyhole to see what's happening in a room, you're peeking.

Glimpse refers to an unintentional or passing look while peek refers to an intentional or secretive look.

Peep.wordDefinition:
Both glimpse and peep refer to seeing something quickly or briefly, but there are some differences between them.

A peep typically involves looking at something secretly or surreptitiously, often with the intention of not being seen.

For example, you might peep through a keyhole to see what someone is doing or take a peep at a wrapped present to try and guess what's inside.

A glimpse is a quick and passing view of something that may be out of reach or fleeting, while a peep is a secret or sneak peek at something hidden or obscured.

Sight.wordDefinition:
A glimpse is a quick or brief look, while a sight is a more prolonged or intentional viewing.

Sight is applicable when you intentionally look at something for a longer period of time, like seeing a beautiful sunset or admiring a painting in a museum.

Glimpse is used for quick and brief looks, while sight is used for more intentional or prolonged viewing.

View.wordDefinition:
Glimpse refers to a quick or brief look at something, while view typically means a broader or more extended look at something.

If you have a view of a mountain range from a lookout point, you can take in the entire expanse and enjoy it for a longer period of time.

Glimpse is often used when referring to a quick or fleeting sight, while view implies a larger or more sustained visual experience.

quotes.Text: A novel can do something that films and TV usually can't - a glimpse inside the characters' heads. I write very tight third person point of view, so the reader is right behind the eyes of each character, seeing what they see and feeling what they feel.
quotes.Title: English Author
quotes.Name: Karen Traviss

quotes.Text: If future generations are to remember us more with gratitude than sorrow, we must achieve more than just the miracles of technology. We must also leave them a glimpse of the world as it was created, not just as it looked when we got through with it.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: Lyndon B. Johnson

quotes.Text: They're odd beasts, musicals, but what I like about them is the way they allow windows into people's lives. When people sing, you get an opportunity to see a vulnerability, a glimpse of a life in a messed-up head.
quotes.Title: English Playwright
quotes.Name: Jack Thorne

quotes.Text: We were talking about the space between us all and the people who hide themselves behind a wall of illusion. Never glimpse the truth - then it's far too late when they pass away.
quotes.Title: British Musician
quotes.Name: George Harrison

quotes.Text: The thing the sixties did was to show us the possibilities and the responsibility that we all had. It wasn't the answer. It just gave us a glimpse of the possibility.
quotes.Title: English Musician
quotes.Name: John Lennon

quotes.Text: Our fears are an amazing gift of the imagination... a way of glimpsing what might be the future when there's still time to influence how that future will play out.
quotes.Title: Author
quotes.Name: Karen Thompson Walker

quotes.Text: There is a glimpse of me that I'd like to keep private. And I believe that is necessary for my kind of sanity. I'd not like the world to know everything about me.
quotes.Title: Indian Actress
quotes.Name: Ileana D'Cruz

quotes.Text: The story of a love is not important-what is important is that one is capable of love. It is perhaps the only glimpse we are permitted of eternity.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Helen Hayes

quotes.Text: Of this our true individual life, our present life is a glimpse, a fragment, a hint, and in its best moments a visible beginning.
quotes.Title: American Philosopher
quotes.Name: Josiah Royce

quotes.Text: When you catch a glimpse of your potential, that's when passion is born.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Zig Ziglar
